div.br:
Grades K- 1: Please visit your teacher's website on Charlotte Lappla Elementary's site.
Grade 2-4: Please visit your teacher's website on Don Gill Elementary's site.
Grades 5-8: Please visit Rock L Butler's main page for links.
Grades 9-12: Login to the Community Portal for all activities.

img.title: arrows

a.title: MENTAL HEALTH MINUTE ZOOM SESSIONS STARTING THIS WEEKs

img.a: MENTAL HEALTH MINUTE ZOOM SESSIONS STARTING THIS WEEKs
img.div: An email was sent to all students in grades 5-12 to inform them that there will be a group zoom sessions held each Tuesday and Thursday at 3pm starting this week. These session will be hosted by Dr. Largey and Miss Le. These will be brief informative sessions that focus on mental health topics such as stress reduction, managing anxiety, health sleep habits, etc. The sessions will be open to questions and answers, but there is no requirement of participation if students choose to just listen. Students interested in participating in these sessions can click on the zoom link in their email. Any questions about these sessions please contact Dr. Largey – blargey@wellsborosd.org or (570)362-1109.
img.a: Read More about MENTAL HEALTH MINUTE ZOOM SESSIONS STARTING THIS WEEKs

img.title: arrows
img.div: For updates and information about the current school closure, please click the banner above or visit: https://closure.wellsborosd.org
img.a: Read More about Order to Close

img.title: arrows
img.div: Reports of a novel (new) virus called CoronaVirus 2019-nCoV, originating in Wuhan, China, have made the news in recent days. Be reassured that the District is monitoring the situation and the emerging facts about the disease through the Center for Disease Control (CDC), World Health Organization (WHO), and the Governor’s office. Click Read More for all the details.

img.title: arrows
img.div: Substitutes needed for teachers, school nurses, instructional aides, custodians, and secretaries.

img.title: arrows
img.div: When moving and / or changing your address, proof of residency must be provided to Sandy Mead, Central Registration, before establishing a bus assignment.
